comments:
This course, Urban Real Estate Economics, uses economic concepts to analyze real estate markets, values and trends. The course focuses on market dynamics in the U.S. and internationally, with an emphasis on how urban growth and local and federal government policies impact urban development and real estate pricing.

Students “learned so much” in this course and enjoyed the emphasis on “both theory and real world application.” One student “never missed a class because the material was so fascinating.”

Professor Wachter is “motivated to convey in her students the same interest she has in the subject matter.” She is “very accessible” and “always willing to help the students.” Professor Wachter has “great insights” and “exposed the class to new and interesting ideas, never before encountered in media or textbooks.” Students also appreciated the “interesting and high profile guest lecturers” she invited. Some students suggest that Professor Wachter should be “better organized,” should post “slides a few days in advance” and that she should “go over the complex subjects more slowly and in more depth.”

This course is recommended to “ANYONE with even the most remote interest in economics and the real estate market.” In spite of “a lot of work” and “too many assigned readings,” students thought it was “a great course overall.\"
